item.question: How could I style my FoxTrick?

answer.xhtml:p: FoxTrick provides a set of presentation interfaces for users to customise their own styles. These interfaces are provided through HTML IDs and classes, and you can use CSS to define your preferred style.

An example user style file can be found here, which you can modify to satisfy your need. After saving the file, you can use the SkinPlugin module for loading the CSS file to have the user style in effect.

item.question: Why should I authorize FoxTrick to access my team data?

answer.xhtml:p: Although most of the data needed by FoxTrick can be fetched directly from the page you are viewing, some modules do require downloading data from Hattrick to work properly.
To download data from Hattrick, including data of your team, leagues, and national teams, you need to authorize FoxTrick in advance.

You authorize FoxTrick by providing your username and password on chpp.hattrick.org in exchange of a verification code, which you provide to FoxTrick. FoxTrick will not know your username or your password in the whole process.
To learn more about the authorize process, please read CHPP - How it works on Hattrick.

item.question: How will FoxTrick protect my privacy?

answer.xhtml:p: Most data passed to third parties, unless explicitly stated below, are sent with HTTP GET method, and will only be sent upon you clicking a link.

That is, you will be able to see what data are passed by inspecting the URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) of an external link, and no data will be sent without your consent. As stated above, no private data is involved.
The only exception is module HTMSPrediction, where match ratings are passed to Hattrick Match Statistics with XMLHttpRequest.

item.question: How do I set the print date format?

answer.xhtml:p: The print date format is used when FoxTrick outputs date and time to the web page. By setting the format you can customize the date format shown.

xhtml:dl.xhtml:dd: Month with or without preceding 0 for one-digit months
Date with or without preceding 0 for one-digit dates
Hour with or without preceding 0 for one-digit hours
Minute with or without preceding 0 for one-digit minutes
Second with or without preceding 0 for one-digit seconds

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: There must be a space between date and time.
Seconds must be the last item.
